name: Water Woes
title: Most Domestic Freshwater Withdrawals
description: In 2021, Brunei had the highest percentage of freshwater withdrawals for domestic use in the world, accounting for 164.67% of its total freshwater withdrawal. This indicates a significant reliance on domestic water resources.

name: Saving Grace
title: Top Net National Savings
description: Brunei achieved the highest net national savings as a percentage of GNI in 2021, with a remarkable 38.38%. This reflects the country's strong economic management and future financial security.

name: Health Priority
title: Highest Government Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, Brunei's domestic general government health expenditure accounted for 92.34% of its current health expenditure, the highest in the world. This underscores the government's commitment to healthcare.

name: Fuel Dependency
title: High Fuel Import Reliance
description: By 2023, fuel imports constituted 63.76% of Brunei's merchandise imports, marking it as one of the highest globally. This highlights the country's dependency on fuel imports for its energy needs.

name: Low Tariff Haven
title: Minimal Tariff Rates on Imports
description: In 2022, Brunei maintained some of the lowest tariff rates globally, with applied weighted mean tariffs on all products at just 0.01% and primary products at 0.01%.

name: Energy Transition Slowdown
title: Minimal Use of Alternative Energy
description: In 2022, only 1% of Brunei's total energy use came from alternative and nuclear sources, indicating a slow transition towards renewable energy.

name: Design Drought
title: Scarce Industrial Design Applications
description: Brunei had only one resident industrial design application in 2017, highlighting a lack of innovation in this sector.

name: Health Investment Lag
title: Low Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, Brunei's current health expenditure was just 1.82% of GDP, one of the lowest globally, indicating limited investment in healthcare.

name: Manufacturing Import Reliance
title: High Dependence on Manufactured Imports
description: In 2023, manufactured goods constituted 27.11% of Brunei's merchandise imports, reflecting a significant reliance on foreign manufacturing.

name: Agricultural Import Minimalism
title: Low Agricultural Raw Material Imports
description: Agricultural raw materials made up only 0.07% of Brunei's merchandise imports in 2023, indicating minimal reliance on foreign agricultural inputs.

name: Remittance Rarity
title: Negligible Personal Remittances
description: In 2023, personal remittances received were a mere 0.006% of Brunei's GDP, one of the lowest globally, suggesting limited reliance on foreign income.
